DOC.brief_summary: Compared early postpartum ( 10-15 week ) observation , paracetamol clearance significantly high ( 21.1 vs 11.7 l.h-1 , + 80 % ) delivery . This high clearance due disproportional increase glucuronidation ( 11.6 vs 4.76 l.h-1 , + 144 % ) , proportional increase oxidation clearance ( 4.95 vs 2.77 l.h-1 , 78 % ) primary renal clearance ( 1.15 vs 0.75 l.h-1 , 53 % ) [ KUlo et al , Int J Obstet Anesth ] . This increase glucuronidation clearance may part drive oestradiol , may explain within individual difference paracetamol metabolism ( e.g . oral contraceptive , follicular v luteal phase , postpartum , pregnancy , duration pregnancy ) young woman . Based pooled analysis , investigator aim explore impact covariates paracetamol metabolism base plasma urine collection woman delivery , postpartum ( early , late ) healthy volunteer , either oral contraceptive ( OC ) follow intravenous ( iv ) paracetamol administration .
